overview: Two mothers, an asylum seeker from Guatemala and an energy lawyer, become unlikely allies while they fight a broken U.S. immigration system. The overall effect is to demystify distorted reportage in hopes of championing urgently needed reforms and disrupting the status-quo of the "immigration genre." Beneath the surface, this is a film about what it means to be a mother and how to find the common humanity in each other.
title: Credible Fear
